jcr:content.jcr:description: Bezons, December 15th 2015 – Worldline is now providing a major Dutch bank with a routing service to process BankID, the new service dedicated to e-Identification for the Dutch market.
jcr:content.jcr:title: Worldline processes e-Identification in The Netherlands

richtext.text:
Bezons, December 15th 2015 – Worldline is now providing a major Dutch bank with a routing service to process BankID, the new service dedicated to e-Identification for the Dutch market.

Several e-merchants and other online players expressed the need for a way to identify persons or parties within the online context, known as electronic identity (e-ID). In 2014, the Dutch Payments Association and its members explored the option of using the banking infrastructure, which is already used for online banking transactions like iDEAL and BVN eMandates, for this e-ID verification service.

Worldline has been active in providing services for Dutch banks for more than 10 years, starting with iDEAL. In 2014, Worldline processed 180 million iDEAL transactions. In April 2015, the BVN eMandate service went live and the first figures are promising. Today, Worldline adds the processing of BankID e-ID checks to its offering. All these services are running on one unique platform, and are therefore creating synergies beneficial for banks, service providing parties like e-merchants and the end-user.

BankID supports services such age verification. For example, in order to complete a purchase on an online liquor store, customers have to prove they are over 18 years old to validate their purchase. BankID will redirect them to their online banking portal and after the familiar log-in; they will have to choose the bank-verified information about their age to prove they are not underage. Once the verification is done, the payment can be validated.

“Worldline is really pleased to extend its services to the Dutch market. The first to provide BankID will be the Dutch tax authority and a Dutch insurance company. In the e-commerce context, e-ID solutions enhance customer experience by seamlessly integrating identification and payment and reducing identity-based fraud cases.” Explains Wolf Kunisch Managing Director Financial Processing & Software Licensing

About Worldline

Worldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. Worldline delivers new-generation services, enabling its customers to offer smooth and innovative solutions to the end consumer. Key actor for B2B2C industries, with over 40 years of experience, Worldline supports and contributes to the success of all businesses and administrative services in a perpetually evolving market. Worldline offers a unique and flexible business model built around a global and growing portfolio, thus enabling end-to-end support. Worldline activities are organized around three axes: Merchant Services & Terminals, Mobility & e-Transactional Services, Financial Processing & Software Licensing. Worldline employs more than 7,300 people worldwide and generated 1.15 billion euros revenues in 2014. Worldline is an Atos company. www.worldline.com
